conclusion: Plan to analyze image and apply electrostatics to find electric field magnitude.
Image shows coordinate system with point charge +q at (0, 0, h) and point of interest at (h, h, -h).
Point charge +q is in vacuum above an infinite conductor with zero electric field inside.
Electric field from +q induces charge distribution on conductor.
Distance from +q to (h, h, -h) calculated using 3D distance formula.
Induced charges create electric field canceling +q's field at (h, h, -h).
Magnitude of electric field at (h, h, -h) equals field from +q.
Using Coulomb's law, field magnitude at (h, h, -h) is \( \frac{k \cdot q}{h^2} \).
